title: Font naming
content:
I still don't believe why Fontlab is soo tricky for naming a font family... I'm getting mad doing this! I have just 3 weights. I checked [http://forum.fontlab.com/fontlab-studio-tips-and-tricks/font-family-nami...](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203081307/http:/forum.fontlab.com/fontlab-studio-tips-and-tricks/font-family-naming-in-fontlab-studio-5-t313.0.html "http://forum.fontlab.com/fontlab-studio-tips-and-tricks/font-family-naming-in-fontlab-studio-5-t313.0.html") but seems to be a bit tricky too. Any other ways to get it right?

Thanks a lot!
author: mikej

comments.content: Providing a description of your problem would be a good place to start.

I think I got it - try and error but works now!  
Thanks!

This should cover most of your issues. [http://www.kltf.de/downloads/FontNaming-kltf.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20100203081307/http:/www.kltf.de/downloads/FontNaming-kltf.pdf "http://www.kltf.de/downloads/FontNaming-kltf.pdf")  
The next tricky thing to figure out is assigning numbers to the weight, but with only 3 you should be fine.
Will the real Mike J please stand up? I repeat, will the real Mike J please stand up?
